The Nujiang river origins in Tanggula Mountains, Tibet Autonomous Region. Flowing across the Tibet and Yunnan Province where makes the Chinese border into northeastern
. Later form the Myanmar-Thailand boundary for about 120 kilometres (75 mi). In
flow across Salween National Park  and again enter Myanmar. Empties into the Andaman Sea of Indian Ocean at the Moulmein.
